chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc.

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel L Wilson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel L Wilson in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Daniel L Wilson.  Prosecuting attorney Alexandria S. Carlson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Scheduling conference held. Parties are continuing negotiations. All conditions of bail remain. Case is adjourned in Branch 36.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel L Wilson in court.  Attorney Katherine Graber in court for Daniel L Wilson.  Attorney Michael R Staskunas in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and an offer from the State. Defense requests an additional scheduling conference date. Court reminds the defendant that bail conditions remain in full force and effect. Case remains calendared in Branch 36.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel L Wilson in court with Attorney Katherine Graber; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Sgt. D. Priewe.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 36.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report 08-03-2022

Defendant Daniel L Wilson in court in person.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness was present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests this matter be set in the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied.  Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Daniel L Wilson in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Daniel L Wilson in custody.  Alexander James Geocaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
